Hi,

Just to be clear I need to know the name of test in the after method not in
the listener.
We are running many tests from different classes and we want to split the
logs for each test to different file.
For this we need to know that @BeforeClass or @AfterClass is called.
We also want to make several operation at the end of each test.
Each test class is extend of general class that containg after test method.
We need to know in this method what is name of the test method.

What is the not standard way to achive this ?
You said that a change may be soon.Can you tell when ?



Thanks
Idan



kentb wrote:
> 
> In JUnit 3 finding the test name was easy, just look at fName. In JUnit 4
> there is not standard way to find out. The listener does know which test
> is

>  
> The listener is not notified when calling @Before and @After methods, but
